notes: On 28 June 2024, SEOS and environmental activists from Bosnia and Herzegovina gathered in Loznica, protesting against the renewed lithium mining initiatives and authorities' cooperation with Rio Tinto, a lithium extracting conglomerate.

On 27 June 2024, citizens and Green-Left activists protested in front of the 'Pink' television in Belgrade - Savski Venac, voicing their indignation with another event where representatives of this television are causing car accidents and injuring minors.

On 26 June 2024, culture workers protested in Belgrade - Stari Grad, dissatisfied that the Belgrade Culture Secretariat did not make any public calls for financing projects. They voiced that they cannot live from enthusiasm.

On 24 June 2024, arms industry workers from Valjevo, represented by their labor unions, protested in Belgrade - Savski Venac against the management of their company, which wanted to shut down the creation of labor unions to improve the workers' conditions. The protesters voiced that such actions are anti-constitutional.

On 19 June 2024, Women in Black and other activists gathered in Belgrade - Stari Grad to raise their voice against sexual violence in conflicts. The protesters also commemorated the victims of sexual violence in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1992-1995.

On 16 June 2024, several thousands residents of Novi Pazar held a protest march starting from the main square in Novi Pazar to show support with the Palestinian people and protest against human right's violation in Gaza.

On 14 June 2024, students and their parents protested against violence in Belgrade - Novi Beograd, demanding security within Serbian schools. The protest is triggered by another violent event in schools, where a parent physically attacked a teacher for giving her child a bad grade.
On 9 June 2024, raspberry farmers blocked the road in Arilje, demanding an increase in the purchase price of raspberries in the Serbian market.
On 9 June 2024, raspberry farmers blocked the road in Pozega, demanding an increase in the purchase price of raspberries in the Serbian market.

On 7 June 2024, residents of the settlement Delijski vis in Nis staged a demonstration and blocked the road near 'Stop Sop' shopping mall in Nis (Nis-Medijana), demanding from the local authorities to pave the streets in their neighborhood, which would prevent the floods that they face every time after heavy rains.

On 7 June 2024, students and feminist activists protested in front of the Faculty of Political Science in Belgrade - Vozdovac, following the naming of a new dean, who has a demonstrated history of sexual harassment of students.

On 4 June 2024, several hundred citizens and Start-Change representatives protested in Belgrade - Novi Beograd against electoral fraud. Local elections in Serbia were followed by several violent incidents targeting opposition representatives.
On 3 June 2024, around 40 farmers protested in Leskovac, demanding state subventions and the same price for food as in other Serbian regions.
On 2 June 2024, raspberry farmers engaged in a protest ride through Pozega, demanding an increase in the purchase price of raspberries in the Serbian market.

assoc_actor_2: DS: Democratic Party; Ecological Uprising; Green-Left Front; People's Party (Serbia); PSG: Movement of Free Citizens
notes: On 2 June 2024, an unidentified group attacked local representatives of opposition parties in Backi Petrovac, including Green-Left front, People's Party, DS, Ecological Uprising, and PSG members. Local elections in Serbia were followed by several violent incidents targeting opposition representatives.

Elections/referendum: On 2 June 2024, Serbia held local elections in 89 cities and municipalities. The coalition surrounding the Serbian Progressive Party (SNS) won power in 85 out of 89 cities and municipalities. Local elections in Serbia were followed by several violent incidents targeting opposition representatives and a rerun of the Belgrade local elections. (coded to Belgrade)

On 2 June 2024, an unidentified attacker assaulted a Green-Left front member of the electoral observation team in Belgrade - Zemun, hitting him in the head with a brick. Local elections in Serbia were followed by several violent incidents targeting opposition representatives.
On 2 June 2024, an unidentified attacker assaulted a journalist from 'Danas' in Novi Sad. The attack occurred while the journalist was surveying people in the streets of Novi Sad.
